entry.summary:
åŸæ–‡ä½œè€…ï¼šCalvinï¼Œå¤ªå’Œç ”ç©¶å‘˜
In 1807, after the defeat of the Danish Navy in Copenhagen, 90,000 oak trees were planted in order to rebuild the Navy and make up for the losses. In 2007, the Danish Nature Agency, the successor to the Royal Forestry Commissioner of Denmark, informed the Danish Ministry of Defense that 90,000 oak trees were ready for the rebuilding of the Navy.
